text: Have you tried the __name__ attribute of the class?
ie x.__class__.__name__ will give you the name of the class, which I think is what you want.
It should work similarly from wherever you call it.
Do you want the name of the class as a string?

code:
>>> class A(object):
...    def whoami(self):
...       print type(self).__name__
...
>>>
>>> class B(A):
...    pass
...
>>>
>>>
>>> o = B()
>>> o.whoami()
'B'
>>>
